definition: Unified Payments Interface - a real-time payment system that facilitates inter-bank transactions through mobile platforms.
Person-to-Person transactions including VPA2ACCOUNT and VPA2VPA transaction categories
Person-to-Merchant transactions, specifically VPA2MERCHANT transaction types.
Success Rate calculated as the count of transactions with status 'DEEMED' or 'SUCCESS' divided by total transaction count, representing the percentage of successful UPI transactions.
Transaction categorization field that classifies UPI transactions as either P2P or P2M based on transaction category
The day of the month extracted from the transaction date, used for daily trend analysis.
Month truncated date from transaction date for monthly analysis
Scan and Pay transactions, including 3P QR and Paytm QR flow categories.
Status classifications for UPI transactions including SUCCESS, DEEMED, and other failure statuses.
Payment Service Provider - entities that facilitate UPI transactions, categorized as Paytm or Others based on handle classification.
Classification of UPI transaction types including P2P, 3P QR, Paytm QR, Intent, P2M Collect, Mandate_Online, Onus_ExcMandates, and Mandate_Onus.
Online transaction category including Intent, P2M Collect, and Mandate_Online flow categories.
On-us transaction category including Onus_ExcMandates and Mandate_Onus flow categories where both payer and payee are within the same payment system.
A transaction status category considered as successful for success rate calculations along with SUCCESS status
A transaction status indicating the transaction was completed successfully
Classification of UPI transactions into different payment flows and types
UPI identifier handles for payer and payee, used to classify transactions by PSP (e.g., paytm, ptyes, ptaxis).
business_alias: Payer Handle, UPI Handle, UPI Handle

definition: The UPI handle of the entity making the payment in a UPI transaction
Payment service provider handles including paytm, ptyes, ptaxis, pthdfc, ptsbi for payer classification
